tasks: Create a simple user persona using the UX Fundamentals' 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com). Document 3 key characteristics and 2 goals. Score improvement: +5% in UX Fundamentals

Write a short reflection on your current collaboration style, focusing on how it affects your design process. Identify one area for improvement and create an action plan to address it. Score improvement: +5% in Collaboration & Communication
Design a basic wireframe of a hypothetical product using the 8-point grid system. Focus on layout and balance. Score improvement: +3% in UI Craft & Visual Design

Conduct a user interview with someone from your network, focusing on their pain points related to [specific topic]. Document 5 key findings using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Score improvement: +7% in User Research & Validation

Create a mind map illustrating the relationships between Jakob’s Law, Aesthetic-Usability Effect, Miller’s Law, and Jakob’s Law. Explain how each concept influences your design decisions. Score improvement: +8% in UX Fundamentals
Redesign your portfolio's navigation using the 8-point grid system. Focus on simplicity and clarity. Score improvement: +5% in UI Craft & Visual Design
Develop a simple usability test plan for a hypothetical product, including 2 user scenarios and 4 usability heuristics to evaluate. Score improvement: +10% in User Research & Validation

Create a short video (5 minutes) explaining the concept of Jakob’s Law and its impact on your design decisions. Share it with your network and gather feedback. Score improvement: +12% in UX Fundamentals
Design a basic prototype of a hypothetical product using Sketch or Figma, focusing on user flow and interaction. Score improvement: +8% in UI Craft & Visual Design

Develop a comprehensive design strategy for a hypothetical product, including user research, usability testing, and design decisions. Share your findings with your network and gather feedback. Score improvement: +20% in Product Thinking & Strategy

Create a capstone project: redesign a real-world product or service using the principles of UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, User Research & Validation, and Collaboration & Communication. Score improvement: +30% across all categories

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, you have the unique opportunity to shape the user experience of innovative products and services. By focusing on empathy-driven design, experimentation, and collaboration, you can unlock new insights and create solutions that delight users and drive business success.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Usability Heuristics for UI Design
topics.summary: Exploring usability heuristics will help Explorer designers develop a solid foundation in user-centered design principles.
practice_points: Analyze 5 existing websites using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design and identify areas for improvement
Create a comprehensive checklist of usability heuristics to apply during the design process
Design 3 wireframes for a hypothetical product feature, incorporating at least 2 usability heuristics

topics.name: Conducting Effective User Research
topics.summary: Gaining experience in user research will enable Explorer designers to develop a deeper understanding of their users' needs and behaviors.
practice_points: Conduct 2 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and document findings
Create a user persona based on existing research data, including demographics, goals, and pain points
Design a survey to gather feedback from 10 participants about a specific product feature

topics.name: Developing Visual Design Principles
topics.summary: Mastering visual design principles will help Explorer designers create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces.
practice_points: Create a comprehensive style guide with color, typography, and spacing tokens for a hypothetical product
Design 3 interactive prototypes in Figma with micro-interactions to demonstrate visual hierarchy and feedback
Analyze the Aesthetic-Usability Effect and apply its principles to redesign a existing website
